fields.description:
It would be nice to have the ability to update JIRA issues from a Confluence page. This integration would provide a useful timesaving feature.

Currently, we can use a blueprint (i.e. Product Requirements) in Confluence to create JIRA issues, but it would be good to be able to update the JIRA issue after it's creation.
fields.summary: Update JIRA issue from Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the macro task report is listing more than one page, than the page where the macro was added won't open

 !Screen Shot 2017-05-02 at 1.13.34 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.0.0-34c6f500ca7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the macro Task Report on a page
# On the macro settings, add more than one page

h3. Expected Results
The page with the macro is shown

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Oops, something went wrong
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Open the page on edition mode:
{{https://<<your instance>>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/editpage.action?pageId=<<your page id>>}}
fields.summary: Pages with task report macro are broken

fields.description:
I see where I can access "Recently worked on" in the side bar when I first log into confluence.

But I am rarely on this page for long. 

What would be helpful is to see "'draft' or 'unpublished changes' lozenge next to their titles" in my sidebar when I am working  (see photo).  So even if I were on another page in this space, the page tree should show the lozenge next to any pages to which they apply.
 !recently updated.jpg|width=695,height=443!
fields.summary: View "Unpublished Changes" in sidebar on page tree

fields.description: As an admin, I would like to be able to see a list of  "draft" pages and pages with unpublished changes.  This would enable me to follow up with users to let them know, in case they just forgot to publish.  This could be part of my side bar, or a feature in the admin functionality.
fields.summary: Enable admins the ability to see titles of "draft" pages and pages with unpublished changes

fields.description: Instead of having to check the "saved changes" to see what is unpublished, then searching in the page for those items when in edit mode, it would be nice if the unpublished changes were identified somehow in the page when in edit mode (and as other issues have recommended, noting the author of the change)
fields.summary: Identify unpublished changes in Edit mode

fields.description:
2 suggestions:

1) When in edit mode, you currently need to click "Changes saved" to see the unpublished changes. I think that should be renamed to "View Unpublished Changes" or "Unpublished changes"  Maybe even make it a button. (I had no idea that it was even a link, or what it allowed me to do.  I stumbled on it)

2) I would prefer not to have to go into edit mode to view the unpublished changes.  I keep trying to click on the notation at the top that says "UNPUBLISHED CHANGES".  I guess intuitively, that's what my mind things should show me the "UNPUBLISHED CHANGES".
fields.summary: Navigation to unsaved changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
PDF Export file name is using GMT instead of local server time.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.1257.2

h3. How to Replicate
# Go to any page, export to PDF

h3. Expected result:
File has 'SpaceKey-PageName-ConfluenceDateTime' format.

h3. Actual result:
File has 'SpaceKey-PageName-SystemDateTime' format.
Because Confluence's "System Time" is GMT but "System Timezone" is "AEST, the file has incorrect time.

h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Export to PDF - File Name is using wrong timezone

fields.description: Grant access to associated content if that content is duplicated to an unrestricted page.
fields.summary: open access to associated content if that content is duplicated to an un-restricted page

fields.description:
In Confluence, when editing a page, inserting wiki references to a bullet list generates a blank line between items.

 

Example:
 * Content here
 * More content here
 * wiki markup (e.g. a link to [http://www.google.com|http://www.google.com/])
 ** Space shows up on top of last item
 * more content

 

I could reproduce the described behaviour on Google Chrome

 

There is a similar bug reported for JIRA Server [JRASERVER-33394|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33394]

Please refer to issue [JST-280210|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-280210] for more details.
fields.summary: Adding links to bullet list adds unwanted blank line
Connect oauth impersonation broken on rest resources that allow service to service impersonation

fields.description:
When creating a page from a blueprint template (example: The Troubleshooting Article template), you will be prompted with a dialog box similar to this:
!Blueprint.png!

Entering the page title there will produce the expected results: the page title field will be automatically set in the editor. 

You can't replicate this behaviour on a custom template though. Creating a "Page Title" variable in the template will trigger a similar prompt, but will not populate the page title field.

Please make it possible for us to replicate Blueprint templates' behaviour on user-created templates.
fields.summary: Page Title Prompt When Creating A Page From Template

fields.description:
It will be great for us to have the ability to configure environment variables within Confluence, such that whenever we add a variable within a page (in edit mode), example:
$DOMAIN

It will automatically resolve to a domain, such as www.example.com (when viewing the page)
fields.summary: Environment Variables For Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Expand macro collapses when the page is refreshed.
If the macro is expanded, once the page is refreshed, it returns to collapsed state, since it's the default configuration for the macro.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option on Expand macro to customize its default status to be expanded or collapsed one the page is refreshed/opened.
Another possible solution for this case is to keep the current status - expanded or collapsed - on the macro when a page is refreshed.

h3. Why this is important
If the page is too big, you need to find the expand/collapse link every time you access or refresh a page.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Expand macro expanded/collapsed default state

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence backup is not progressing and there has been no status change in the Confluence UI for quite some time (30-60minutes). 

The UI is stuck at message "Getting Objects to Export" 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a new backup using the Backup Manager in Confluence

 

Expected Results

Backup starts, then completes successfully.

 

Actual Results

Confluence Backup is stuck and there is no progress update in the UI or the UI displays a message "Getting Objects to Export". 
h3. Workaround 

There is a possibility that the Backup has been terminated and the Confluence UI is unable to fetch the latest status.

Contact support at support.atlassian.com with reference to this bug.
fields.summary: Confluence Backup is stuck due to a restart

fields.description:
It would be better if the users were able to copy a cell pattern to create more customized tables. For an example: User has table with 3 columns and 3 rows. The last column has more than one item per row, so each row would be divided in N parts. It's not practical to create a table with a bigger of rows and then merge them to fit your needs. 

Example:
!image-2017-04-25-16-29-29-650.png!
 
 Also, tables can be created to a maximum size of 15x20, and it's not possible to expand tables by copying a pattern of cells and pasting it on the table.

 

*Why would this be important*
 * Users importing customized tables from spreadsheet editors and want to manipulate these tables in an easier way

*Workaround*
 * Create and copy tables from spreadsheet editor and manipulate data directly on table
fields.summary: Confluence Table Editor Improvement

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence site import fails with insufficient privilege for site-admin users.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a personal space

- Login as regular Confluence user (separate account from the cloud admin user). 
- Create a personal space 
- Edit the permissions for the personal space and remove admin privileges from "site-admin" and "administrator" groups.

2. Perform site-import using the cloud admin user.


h3. Expected Results

Site import by the admin user should wipe out the existing Confluence data and import should proceed


h3. Actual Results

Import will fail or task status will be stuck on "Deleting existing data"

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround

Contact support to verify if the failed import is indeed running into this bug.
fields.summary: Site import fails with insufficient privilege for site-admin users.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Hyperlinks to anchors in Confluence Page are not editable when the title has spacial characters
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a special character in the title (pipe, for example)
 # Insert anchor macros to the page
 # Insert links to the anchor
 # Save the page and exit the editor
 # Edit the page

h3. Expected Results

You are able to edit the links.
h3. Actual Results

The link editor (popup) does not appear.
h3. Notes
* It is possible to note that if you add a page with *&*, for example, then publish the page, going to try to edit the anchor link it will show the specia character in markup *& am p ;* (typed this way, as JIRA reads as the special character) - and that's the moment where you are not able to edit the anchor link.
 
h3. Workaround

Remove the special characters from the title.
fields.summary: Hyperlinks to anchors in Confluence Page  are not editable when the title has special characters

h3. Summary
Using the *Children Display* macro with the attribute _excerptType_ set to *rich content*, the macro will appear as broken if one of the children pages to be displayed has an attachment displayed as a link instead of thumbnail.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.1223.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Put a *Children Display* macro on a page.
# Display an attachment as link on a child of the parent page from above.

h3. Expected Results
The *Children Display* macro displays its content properly.

h3. Actual Results
The *Children Display* macro displays the following error message on the page:
{code}Error rendering macro 'children' : [com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException] Duplicate attribute 'data-linked-resource-id'. at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,982]{code}

Following error is displayed in Confluence logs:
{noformat}
2017-04-24 17:30:24.218380500  -- url: /wiki/display/spacekey/pagetitle | page: PAGEID | traceId: c8cb882505747d21 | userName: sysadmin | referer: https://CloudURL.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/editpage.action?pageId=PAGEID | action: viewpage
2017-04-24 17:30:24.218381500 [com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException] com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxParsingException: Duplicate attribute 'data-linked-resource-id'.
2017-04-24 17:30:24.218419500  at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,679]
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The search input box to restrict users or groups doesn't show any results. It doesn't load a spinning wheel or display any dialog that shows functionality.

The problem was found to happen when either:
* user double-clicks on the padlock icon to access the Page Restrictions
* the page didn't complete loading when the padlock icon is clicked on.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any Confluence page
# Click on the 'padlock' icon using double mouse click
# Select one of the bottom 2 options to restrict content. A search bar will appear
# enter any text to do a user or group search

h3. Expected Results
Users or groups are searched.
Spinning wheel shows while waiting for results
Results are shown in a list.

h3. Actual Results
No search is triggered in the browser.
The search input box is smaller than normal.
Network activity shows no request.
 !search-not-working-example.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
For testing the scenario when the padlock is clicked before the page completed loading it will require a slow computer or browser.

h3.Workaround
Only click once when accessing the Page restriction section.
Wait a few more seconds for the page to load completely before accessing the section.
fields.summary: Unable to search users in page restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When doing a user or group search to set Permissions on a page, the results are not reflecting the search pattern when the search has a space. Example: A search for "test j" will return the same results as "test" without considering the space or the letter "j".

*Problem:*
If the site has more than 6 users with the same name but different last name, the searchable user may not be listed at all, and incorrect users will be listed

h3. Environment
* Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create at least 7 users with the same first name but different last names
# Search for the 7th user using the Last name initial

*Expected Results:*
* User is listed because it is matches the search.
* Other users not matching the search pattern are not listed.

*Actual Results:*
User is not listed at all
!test1.jpg|thumbnail!
the user "Test Jk" exists and should be listed.

The search is triggering the call:
{noformat}
https://site.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/prototype/1/search/user-or-group.json?max-results=6&query=test+j&_=1492998751784
{noformat}
that returns the same results as "query=test" and don't include "Test Jk" because it is limited to 6 results.

h3. Notes
Searching with the first 2 letters of the last name will return the correct results
!test2.jpg|thumbnail!

User mentions on pages and comments are not affected because they use a different rest api call to get search results.

h3.Workaround
Search for more than 2 letters for first and last names.
fields.summary: User and Group search doesn't return correct results for 1 character after space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence-Only users are unable to view issues in a JIRA Issues Macro despite the Project queried is accessible to anonymous users

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Project which is has the Browse Project permissions to *Group (Anyone)* so that it is accessible to [Anonymous Users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Allowing+anonymous+access+to+your+project]
# Create a Page within Confluence which includes a JIRA Issue Macro referencing this Anonymous project
# Have a Confluence-Only user login and navigate to the page that was created to view the macro

h3. Expected Results
User is able to view JIRA issues in the JIRA Issues Macro

h3. Actual Results
Confluence-only user is presented with a message stating:
{quote}Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error.
View these issues in JIRA{quote}
 
h3. Notes
In a non-Service Desk instance, the User can click on the "View these issues in JIRA" link and view them through the issue navigator, however if Service Desk is enabled, the user is taken to the Service Desk Portal. 

h3.Workaround
- Make the Confluence Space is [Publicly Accessible|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/make-a-space-public-827106208.html] and have the Confluence-Only user logout; they would be able to see both the Page and Issues within the JIRA Issues Macro
- If the Confluence Space cannot be made Publicly Accessible or if JIRA Service Desk is used, grant the user JIRA (Core or Software) Access

fields.description:
h2. *Current Behaviour*

If you have a page that has a lot of content or a very long table, adding rows or modifying rows on the table, OR even adding a content somewhere on the page seems to be not very efficient as currently when clicking on edit, it would bring you to the top of the page, then you'd have to scroll down to the relevant place to modify
h2. *Requested Behaviour*

It would be helpful if when entering the Edit mode from somewhere on the page, especially within a table, that you are positioned at the same row or section in the page as you had immediately previously been viewing.

Similarly, it would also help if when exiting out of Edit, that you are returned to approximately the last location you were editing.

This would save a lot of time in the editing, updating, and viewing process.
fields.summary: Linking of view location with edit location and vice versa.

fields.description:
When running a site export the progress bar shows the export is in progress but never completes. In fact the backup has successfully completed but the completion status, and the download link, are never communicated to the user.

*Diagnosis*

Check for this line in logs:
{quote}Site export (backup) finished. Filename = temp/filestore/<file id>. File size = 0. Duration = 25243504.
{quote}
*Workaround*

It may be possible to download the file directly from the file store using the file id in the above message. The feasibility of this needs to be confirmed by support.

Note the file is only available for 7 days.
fields.summary: User interface shows export in progress but export is complete

Image attachments in Confluence become blurry

# Edit page
# Image shows up blurry
# Click Border button to toggle border on and off
# Image becomes sharp
# Click on "Resize image to small" button
# Click on "Resize image to medium" button to bring it back to the size it was previously
# Image is blurry again

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA issue event add event fails when JQL exceeds the character limit. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create several custom fields and apply them to the project.
# Create issues.
# Install Team Calendar in Confluence.
# Add event JIRA issue dates event in your calendar and include several custom fields.

h3. Expected Results
The event is added without failure. 
h3. Actual Results
The event fails to add if the JQL along with custom field names exceeds 255 characters 
{noformat}
0 Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Batch entry 0 INSERT INTO "AO_950DC3_TC_JIRA_REMI_EVENTS" ("KEY_ID", "SUB_CALENDAR_ID", "USER_ID", "JQL", "TICKET_ID", "ASSIGNEE", "STATUS", "TITLE", "DESCRIPTION", "EVENT_TYPE", "UTC_START", "UTC_END", "ALL_DAY", "ISSUE_LINK", "ISSUE_ICON_URL") VALUES 
caused by:
2017-04-18 13:28:42.265376500 org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
JQL is limited to 255 Characters (AO_950DC3_TC_JIRA_REMI_EVENTS") for Jira Issue Events for Team Calendar. Checking a few custom fields can end up hitting the limit along with the syntax i.e. Project and custom-field=date ect.

h3.Workaround
Create several JIRA issue events on the same calendar to divide the JQL so it doesn't exceed 255 characters.
fields.summary: Increase JIRA issue date character limit for JQL.

fields.description:
Hi Ben,
 
Wanted to give a more detailed description of what I think is going on with me, my Developers, and Product folks in Confluence. This is all clearly User Error on our end - but since so many people are making the same mistake/sharing a misconception about the buttons I just wanted to share. As you know I've been using Confluence for ages so it seems like there must have been an update that changed the buttons... but maybe not. Maybe there are unconscious factors from other products or tools we are all using that are changing our expected or usual habit. Anyway....
 
These are the options we have on our Confluence pages.
 
*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Open Confluence Page/doc
 # Make changes
 # Hit "Save and Close"
 # Changes are saved, but +not+ published 
 
*Expected Behavior:* 
 # Open Confluence Page/doc
 # Make changes
 # Hit "Save and Close"
 # Changes are saved +and+ published 
 
*Actual Behavior:*
 # Open Confluence Page/doc
 # Make changes
 # Hit "Save and Close"
 # Changes are saved, but +not+ published 
 # 
Basically it seems like even though the Update button is very clear and in Blue we are being super drawn to "Save" 
 
Let me know if I can give any other info! I have had three developers mention them doing the same thing; and myself and a product person have as well. I have had to explain to others why/what has happening because they couldn't figure it out.
fields.summary: Customer feedback regarding "Save and close"

Drafts from pages already created not being saved in the user profile.
This makes users unable to discard drafts.

# Click on Profile picture -> Drafts
# The draft is not there
# Users not able to discard the draft

h3. Expected Results
# Edit an existing page in Confluence
# Make changes and hit 'Save and close'
# Click on Profile picture -> Drafts
# The draft is there and the user is able to resume or discard it if want.

h3.Notes
If you create a new page and edit it, the draft will be saved and the user is able to see it through the User Profile. After the second time editing the page, the draft is no longer being saved and visible in the user profile

Edit and discard recently change manually in the page.

fields.description:
With the addition of collaborative editing, iterative edits cannot be done without also publishing the content. In addition, publishing the content with multiple users making edits will publish incomplete content.

therefore, here are a few improvements that may help improve the usability and the intuitive nature of collaborative editing:

1) It would be really nice if there were a way to view the diff from the last published version of a page to the current draft status. That way it would be much easier to undo changes without potentially having to publish and then revert unintentional changes.

2) The old "Discard Draft" functionality did warn before discarding others changed IIRC, it would be nice if the Update/Publish button could do the same if there are multiple people editing.

3) Relying on undo/redo while editing makes sense, but it appears that the Redo keyboard shortcut is Cmd+Y on Mac which is the Windows standard Redo shortcut with Cmd swapped for Ctrl. It would be nice if the shortcut could be made Cmd+Shift+Z for Mac clients since that is the standard Mac redo shortcut.

4) It would be nice for changes that users are making to be highlighted so that you can see who is making what changes.
fields.summary: Collaborative Editing daft Differences, history, and  Edit highlights.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Application Link between Confluence and JIRA
 # Set the Display URL to a non-existent address, or to a proxy address that is reachable from the client's browser, but not accessible from the Confluence Server itself (the whole point of having an Application URL / Display URL separation)
 # Create a page and add a JIRA issue into the page
 # Export the page to PDF

You will notice Errors such as these:
{code:java}
2014-03-22 17:57:51,167 WARN [http-8542-1] [confluence.extra.flyingpdf.ConfluenceExportUserAgent] getImageResource Could not retrieve image resource http://192.168.2.3:8614/jira614/images/icons/statuses/open.png during Confluence export
 -- url: /c542/spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action | page: 1933317 | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8542/c542/display/GIE/sa+dasd+as+d+assad | action: pdfpageexport
{code}
It seems that the getImageResource will attempt to obtain /images/icons/statuses/open.png via the Display URL, and not the Application URL. The Confluence Server is unable to reach the Display URL, hence, the error
h3. Workaround

Not workaroundable in Cloud yet
fields.summary: PDF Export Retrieves Images From JIRA Macros via the Display URL and not the Application URL

Otherwise, "Recently Visited Spaces" will have duplicates from the manually controlled application links.

 

Also, why are the links SO BIG?!?! Please let us customize this list with more control. Let us "Pin" spaces, instead of offering whatever recent links "the system" thinks are best.

!1492094303_chrome.png!
fields.summary: Take out "Recent Spaces" From app navigator, allow Sysadmin to "Pin" spaces for entire company, using same visibility controls as Application Links

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.1212.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an full site XML backup
# Setup a server instance of the latest Confluence version (6.1.1)
# Import the backup

h3. Expected Results
Restore completes fully

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
Caused by: org.xml.sax.SAXException: Error while importing backup: not-null property references a null or transient value : com.atlassian.confluence.setup.bandana.ConfluenceBandanaRecord.key
net.sf.hibernate.PropertyValueException: not-null property references a null or transient value : com.atlassian.confluence.setup.bandana.ConfluenceBandanaRecord.key
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.parser.BackupParser.endElement(BackupParser.java:45)
{noformat}

Similar issue to [XML import fails due to error: not-null property references a null or transient value|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/xml-import-fails-due-to-error-not-null-property-references-a-null-or-transient-value-666601423.html]. From the error though, there is a null in the {{com.atlassian.confluence.setup.bandana.ConfluenceBandanaRecord.key}} column.

The issue we're seeing specifically on two instances is with the following entry: *com.atlassian.confluence.security.login.DefaultLoginManager*.
 
h3. Notes
Table in Cloud is set up properly though, so we don't know how the NULL value is getting in there:
{code}
confluence_355851=> \d bandana
               Table "public.bandana"
     Column     |          Type          | Modifiers
----------------+------------------------+-----------
 bandanaid      | bigint                 | not null
 bandanacontext | character varying(255) | not null
 bandanakey     | character varying(100) | not null
 bandanavalue   | text                   |
{code}

h3.Workaround
In the cloud instance:
# Run this to find the NULL values:
{code:sql}
select * from bandana
where bandanaid is null
or bandanacontext is null
or bandanakey is null;

select * from bandana
where bandanacontext = ''
or bandanakey = '';
{code}
# Delete the values
# Restart Confluence and create a new export
fields.summary: Null value in BANDANA table causing XML restore to fail.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The import space feature sometimes got stuck on "Applying special processing" or in "Retrieving uploaded file" and never finishes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Import Space feature on Confluence
 # Follow the steps to import a space
h3. Expected Results

The import is finished correctly, following to JIRA Macro repair feature.

 
h3. Actual Results

The process got stuck on "Applying special processing" and it gives no error message or warning, however, the space is imported successfully after some time, although no "Acknowledge" message appears.

 
h3. Notes

The problem seems to be intermittent.
The JIRA Macro repair does not seems to work correctly in the Spaces imported.
 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: The import space feature sometimes got stuck on "Applying special processing" or in "Retrieving uploaded file" and never finish

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Import a Confluence Site has some instructions which say:
"_Site import supports zip files with a maximum nullMB of data (the uncompressed XML files inside the backup zip file) and an unlimited amount of attachments._"

Notice the "_null_" before the maximum XML size.
h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.1212.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Confluence Administration > Import Site

h3. Expected Results
It should display an actual size limit of the XML (if we still have one).
h3. Actual Results
It says "_null_"
fields.summary: Import Site instructions says it "supports zip files with a maximum nullMB of data"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, user email is visible for all users even though the *User Email visibility* is set to be visible for *site-administrators* only.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud version {{1000.1200.0}} 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *Security Configuration* in Confluence.
# Set *User Email Visibility* to *only visible to site administrators*.
# Log in as a normal Confluence user (who is not a site admin).
# Hover over another user's name.

h3. Expected Results
User's email not to be visible.

h3. Actual Results
User email is visible.
 
h3.Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Email is visible for all even when Email visibility is set to site admin

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After Collaborative Editing enabled, 'Find and Replace' function is not working properly.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.1200.0
* Collaborative Editing enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a page > *Edit*
# Use "Ctrl + F" to open the 'Find and Replace' function
# Search for a word
# Click 'Next' to search for the word

h3. Expected Results
The word is highlighted and user will be able to replace the word(s).

h3. Actual Results
# The word is highlighted, then disappear.
# 'Replace' button is greyed out.

h3. Notes
This does not affect 'Replace All' functionality
fields.summary: 'Find and Replace' Is Not Working Properly
After File Upload Site Import Progress Bar is not 100%

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to print a page in Confluence (using right click > Print or CMD/CRTL+P) the content will be generated including the left sidebar and the navigation at the top:

!navigation.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any page on Confluence
# Right click on the page.
# Select Print.

h3. Expected Results
The print should include only the the page content, like an export to Word/PDF.

h3. Actual Results
The print includes the sidebar and the page content as well.

h3. Notes
Affects multiple browsers. 

h3.Workaround
There's no workaround for the issue.
fields.summary: Printing a Page Includes the Left Sidebar and Top Navigation Menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Balsamiq won't enter in presentation mode (full screen) if Confluence has SPA layout.
h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.1177.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Confluence in SPA mode
# Have Balsamiq mockup add-on
# Create a page and add the Balsamiq macro and configure it to display a mockup
# Save the page
# When viewing the page click the Balsamiq button to enter in presentation mode (full screen)

h3. Expected Results
The mockup is displayed in full screen
h3. Actual Results
The mockup becomes a gray area in the page
 
h3. Notes
Confluence must have SPA

h3.Workaround
When editing the page it is possible to enter in presentation mode.
fields.summary: Balsamiq doesn't enter presentation mode (full screen)

fields.description:
This issue raises an important missing feature: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Is-it-possible-to-find-the-available-anchors-in-a-page-when/qaq-p/387642.]

While it's easy enough to create anchors, it's hard to link to them or even see them.  This is especially true since Markup view was done away with.  I guess I can start to edit a page, look for anchors and cancel the edit.  That is really ugly.  How about a better solution?
fields.summary: need to see and link to anchors

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a page contains Page Layout section and the content of this page is longer than one page in the PDF export, PDF export inserts an extra page break before the page.

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.1177.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add addtional Page Layout Section
# Add enough content to the page so it will require at least two pages in PDF
# Export the page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
* The exported PDF should not contain an extra page

h3. Actual Results
* PDF export creates extra page breaks when long page contains Page Layout Section
fields.summary: PDF export creates extra page breaks when long page contains Page Layout Section

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you try to display a user avatar on a page using the attachments macro, the page will fail to be saved.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.1177.1
* Reproducible with and without *Collaborative Editing* enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page.
# Attach a user avatar with the *Insert files and images* macro.
# Save/Update the page

h3. Expected Results
The page is saved/updated successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The page throws the error message: *There was an error processing the request*.
The following can be seen in Confluence logs:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: RuntimeException occurred while transforming editor format to storage format (com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.model.resource.identifiers.ResourceIdentifierCreationException: Error creating resource identifier for resource Attachment: user-avatar v.1 (196622) smackie: Invalid attachment container: UserResourceIdentifier{userKey=ff80808155e3b16f0155e3c5ef11000a, userName='null'})
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Use the *Profile Picture* macro to display a user avatar instead.
fields.summary: In Confluence, displaying a user avatar as attachment on a page will prevent the page from being saved.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a page contains a Children Display macro, the link on the Children macro is broken on HTML Space Export
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.1177.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in a space
 # Insert *Children Display* macro
 # Go to the space and choose *Space tools* > *Content Tools* on the sidebar.
 # Choose *Export*.
 # Select *HTML* then choose *Next*.
 # Select *Custom Export* and select the pages you want to export.
 # Choose *Export*. This will create a zipped archive of HTML files.
 # When the export process has finished, download the zipped archive as prompted, and extract the files into a folder.
 # Access the link on the HTML page that contains the Display Children macro

h3. Expected Results

The link on the HTML page that contains the Display Children macro should work
 * The link should be something like {{[file:///Users/username/Desktop]}}

h3. Actual Results

The link on the HTML page that contains the Display Children macro is broken
 * The link is {{[file:///wiki/display]}}
fields.summary: Children Display macro link is broken on HTML export

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When doing the on board on Confluence and the language is configured to Russian the text field for the avatar upload is merged with the "Save" button.

!Screen Shot 2017-04-09 at 5.21.56 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Onboarding in Confluence when language is setup for Russian is showing avatar upload button mixed up with the save button

fields.description: We want to use the confluence knowledge base to hold articles related to our support site. this includes login credentials and passwords. we are looking for a solution that will encrypt the passwords (similar to what Evernote provides) that only a person with the key can unlock and view the password.
fields.summary: A feature to encrypt text in Knowledge base

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have a JIRA Projects macro on a page and you configure it to display 3 columns, it doesn't actually displayed the 3 columns aligned, the third column is always dropped to the second line.
h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud version 1000.1177.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have at least 3 JIRA projects (I recommend having 4 or more)
# Create a Confluence page and add the JIRA Projects macro
# Configure it to display 3 columns and save the page

h3. Expected Results
The macro would display 3 projects per line (3 columns)
h3. Actual Results
Only 2 columns are displayed, the third one drops to the second line
fields.summary: JIRA Projects Macro columns not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* Pages with Google Sheet embedded in iFrame macro focuses iFrame Automatically

h3. Environment

*  Confluence 1000.1177.1 - Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new page in Confluence
# Add iFrame Macro to page
# In the iFrame macro, embed a Google Sheets link
# Publish page
# When page loads, click 'E' on keyboard for 'Edit' page shortcut           

h3. Expected Results

* Loads Confluence page editor

h3. Actual Results

Enters a letter 'e' in the Google Sheets doc in the first cell

h3.Workaround:

None
fields.summary: Pages with Google Sheet embedded in iFrame macro focuses iFrame Automatically

fields.description:
When navigating a in a confluence page, it's not possible to apply filters
in confluence tables.
This is annoying because each user needs to manually look into the full
table himself in order to find an item.

Because of this, In order to display a simple table for quick reference,
I'll need to maintain an excel spreadsheet outside of confluence and refer
to it to my audience.

It would be great to be able to at least filter information on them.
Thanks,
fields.summary: Suggestion for Confluence Tables

fields.summary: Include macro are displayed as broken macro in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting a space as PDF, deselecting all pages or selecting only the top level page with Custom Export will still generate a PDF export of all pages in the space

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the space's {{Space Tools >> Content Tools >> Export >> PDF}}
# Choose *Custom Export*
# Select only the top level page, and deselect every other page in the space, especially its children pages (only 1 page selected)

h3. Expected Results
Only 1 page would be included in the PDF export

h3. Actual Results
All pages in the space will be included in the PDF export
fields.summary: PDF export generates export of all pages in the space even though there are no pages selected with "Custom Export"

fields.description: Some customers may not be able to find the space tools link anymore.
fields.summary: SpaceTools option has disappeared for some users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If Multiple Section Macros are used within a single cell of a Confluence Table, editing the page will break the table and content is no longer formatted in the table

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a New Page and insert a table
# Add 2 Section Macros to a single Cell
# Add a Column Macro into each of the Section Macros with text 
# Publish and view the page
# Return to editor by Editing the Page

h3. Expected Results
Editor loads the table in its entirety.

h3. Actual Results
When the Page is edited, the Top Most Section Macro is kept in its table, however after that, the remainder of the table is broken.  Any content that was in the table is now text on the body of the page.

Video Clip was too large to upload; unlisted on Youtube: https://youtu.be/WnH6HgDyQXA
 
h3. Notes
When the user goes to edit the page, the Editor seems to load the table fully, and then it breaks.
If a User publishes changes rather than navigating back or "Save and Closing", even if they did not make additional changes, page shows in a broken state
Video Attached to show more details

h3.Workaround
Separate Section Macros into their own Table Cells if used in a Table.
fields.summary: Table Breaks on Edit if Multiple Section Macros are Used in a Single Table Cell

fields.description:
When creating JIRA tickets from a Confluence table, I often want to add them in an epic.  If there is 1 epic listed on the page, this feature works perfectly.  However, when there are 2 or more epics on the page, I am unable to mass-create JIRA tickets and associate them with any epic.

If there are 2+ epics on a page, I'd like to be able to choose what epic I'd like to associate the epics with when I right-click to create tickets.
fields.summary: When creating JIRA tickets from Confluence table be able to choose from multiple epics

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a Page Properties contains multiple JIRA issues, it will show _Getting Issue Details..._ in Page Properties Report Macro.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 1000.1172.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start with a JIRA + Confluence Cloud instance.
 # In Confluence, create a page with a Page Properties Report macro on it.
 # Create another page with the Page Properties macro in it that'll show in the Page Properties Report macro above.
 # Insert a table into the Page Properties macro that contains multiple JIRA Issues Macro that shows multiple JIRA Issue
 # View the original page with the Page Properties Report on it.

h3. Expected Results

Page Property Report shows Details of JIRA Issue
h3. Actual Results

No Errors are generated in the Logs or in the Browser Debug Console.
 If a JIRA Issue Macro is used, it will show a Spinner Loading Icon with the message "Getting Issue Details..."
 - !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 - !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

It looks like adding a JIRA issue macro on the page with the Page Properties Report macro will let the Page Properties Report macro to display it properly.
fields.summary: Multiple JIRA issue macro failed to load in Page Properties report

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When *Collaborative Editing* is enabled and sections are used, the search function will not highlight matching terms properly. The first one will be matched but the next attempts will just highlight the word(s) quickly then disappear making it hard to locate the matching cases.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.1172.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert some sections on your page
# Search for a word/pattern that is present more than once on your page.
# Click on *Next* to find the next occurrence of the word/pattern.

h3. Expected Results
The matching word(s)/pattern are highlighted properly.

h3. Actual Results
The matching word(s)/pattern are highlighted only for a split second after the first match.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround apart from not using *Sections*.
fields.summary: Search feature does not work properly when Collaborative Editing is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Copying a page will duplicate all of the original page's attachments and labels, but won't copy comments from the original page.
h3. Suggested Solution

Include to copy comments when copying a page. 

Also, provide a warning that comments will not be copied when copying a page.
fields.summary: Include to copy comments when copying a page
